content: According to the official EARIST Website as of November 20, 2025, the Executive Officials leading the Institute are defined as follows: Dr. Rogelio T. Mamaradlo serves as the Institute President and concurrently acts as the Interim Dean for the College of Engineering. Dr. Allan Q. Quismundo holds the position of Executive Vice President and is the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) Dean of the Graduate School. Dr. Eric C. Mendoza is the Vice President for Academic Affairs. Dr. Yolanda A. Lara serves as the Vice President for Administration and Finance and is also the Director of Financial Management Services. Ms. Gilda S. Familara serves as the College and Board Secretary.

According to the official EARIST Website as of November 20, 2025, the following officials serve as Deans of the various Colleges: Ar. Diane A. Jose is the Dean of the College of Architecture and Fine Arts (CAFA). Mrs. Rodora T. Oliveros is the Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences (CAS). Dr. Willy O. Gapasin leads the College of Business and Public Administration (CBPA). Dr. Jesus S. Paguigan is the Dean of the College of Computing Studies (CCS). Dr. Anabel D. Riva serves as the Dean of the College of Criminal Justice (CCJ). Dr. Evangeline M. Sangalang is the Dean of the College of Education (CED). Dr. Maria Rhoda D. Dinaga is the Dean of the College of Hospitality and Tourism Management (CHTM). Dr. Erwin P. Ordovez is the Dean of the College of Industrial Technology (CIT). Additionally, Dr. Agnes N. Coo serves as the Administrator for the EARIST Cavite Campus. Note that the College of Engineering is led by Interim Dean Dr. Rogelio T. Mamaradlo, and the Graduate School is led by OIC-Dean Dr. Allan Q. Quismundo.

content: According to the official EARIST Website as of November 20, 2025, the Directors for Administrative, Research, and Academic Support Services include: Dr. Giovanni L. content: According to the official EARIST Website as of November 20, 2025, the Directors for Specialized Services, External Relations, and Business Development are: Engr. Jerome M. According to the official EARIST Website as of November 20, 2025, the Board of Trustees (BOT) is the governing body of the Institute, composed of the following officials:

The Chairman of the Board is Hon. Dr. Desiderio Apag, III, who serves as the CHED Commissioner. The Vice Chairman is Hon. Rogelio T. Mamaradlo, the EARIST President.

Legislative representatives include Hon. Alan Peter S. Cayetano (Member, Senate Committee on Education, Arts & Culture) and Hon. Mark O. Go (Member, Chair of the Committee of Higher and Technical Education).

Government agency representatives include Hon. Engr. Romelen T. Tresvalles (Member, DOST-NCR Director) and Hon. Hazel Iris S. Baliatan (Member, Director IV, Public Investment Staff, NEDA).

Sectoral and Private representatives include:
* Hon. Arnel S. Abrenica (Member, Private Sector Representative)
* Hon. Allen R. Buenaventura (Member, Private Sector Representative)
* Hon. Agnes F. Amorin (Member, EARIST Alumni Association Inc. President)
* Hon. Carl Justine B. Dioquino (Member, Federated EARIST ISG President)

The Board Secretary is Ms. Gilda S. Familara.

The Management Information Services (MIS) at EARIST provides specific technical support for student portal and account issues. Students who encounter problems regarding uploading photos, forgotten accounts, waiting for emails, or unfinished applications are instructed to message or email the MIS team at mis.support@earist.edu.ph for assistance. The policy clarifies that for all other concerns outside of these specific technical issues, students must approach the Registrar's Office or the Admission Office.
